attributes.action: Request the Home Office to remove "Place of birth" from British passports
attributes.background: Following recent US/Trump policy to ban Muslims/individuals, many British citizens will be affected adversely due to their place of birth as they face various complications. This is a violation of human rights & an act of discrimination when 2 citizens of same country are treated differently.
attributes.additional_details:
Travelers seeking to enter the United States for business or tourism or in transit for less than 90 days may be eligible to travel to the United States visa free under the Visa Waiver Program if they meet specific requirements. This will affect those British citizens whose place of birth is one of those listed countries (e.g. high visa cost, length visa processing, potential of being treated differently by officials once in the US, etc.) 
https://uk.usembassy.gov/visas/visa-waiver-pro

attributes.action: Get the M.o.D. to agree to a last minute bid to purchase the ex-HMS Illustrious
attributes.background: There is a new consortium currently negotiating with the M.o.D. with respect to purchasing the ex-Royal Navy Aircraft Carrier HMS Illustrious, which if allowed to proceed, would save her from the scrapyard and instead see her preserved as a heritage attraction for the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The funds necessary to cover all aspects of the purchase are in place, thus all that is required is for the M.o.D. to agree, and this iconic ship - the last surviving Invincible Class Aircraft Carrier, can be secured as an asset for the nation, for present and future generations to visit. Despite having received several high value heritage bids, the MoD instead agreed a much lower value scrap deal, clearly not the best financial option for the taxpayer. She is still en route under tow to Turkey.

attributes.action: Create a bottle deposit scheme for the UK similar to those used in Scandinavia.
attributes.background: The deposit return scheme sees a small deposit (approx. 10p) added to the cost of a drinks container which is refunded when the container is recycled. The impacts in terms of energy costs and CO2 emissions can be considerable. The scheme also helps to reduce littering and it's environmental impacts.
attributes.additional_details: Sweden offers a world-leading example of how to deal with waste from drinks bottles and cans.  The scheme has resulted in recycling rates of more than 90 per cent of its drinks containers. Recycling glass can save 80 per cent of raw materials mined and, with recycled aluminium saving 95 per cent of the energy it takes to make new aluminium. The success of the 5 pence levy on single-use plastic bags proves that these kinds of policies can work well in the UK.

attributes.action: Stop the the imposition of business rates on solar panels
attributes.background:
the recent reductions in tariff incentives for solar and other renewables has greatly reduced the ability of people to fund renewables  
the imposition of business rates on solar in particular will make many schemes uneconomic and result in them being removed
attributes.additional_details: the business community is putting together a letter to the chancellor spelling out the underdesirable affects of this tax rise

attributes.action: High sentences on gang bullying
attributes.background: As parents we need the help from the government to reduce the the amount of gang bullying on the streets where there is filming taking place of these children being beaten up for the fun of it. With a strong punishment now in court for this kind of behaviour.

attributes.action: Erect a statue of Nye Bevan in the Houses of Parliament celebrating the NHS.
attributes.background: The founder of the greatest achievment this country has witnessed should be recognised, by a statue in the houses of parliament.

attributes.action: Open an enquiry into the abuse of psychoactive substances (NPS) within prison
attributes.background: The growing use of new and largely non-detectable psychoactive substances (NPS) is leading to increased violence, bullying, debt and medical emergencies requiring hospitalisation. We demand a thorough enquiry immediately to investigate the claims made in the Secret Lives of Prisons Documentary
attributes.additional_details:
People in prison, prisoners and staff, are
less safe than they were five years ago. This year more
prisoners were murdered, killed themselves, self harmed
and were assaulted than ever before
Serious assaults in prison have more than
doubled in the last three years. 
Rates of self-harm are at the highest level ever
recorded. There were 32,313 self-harm incidents in
2015—a nearly 40% rise in just two years.
We believe this is a direct result of overcrowding and  NPS. We demand an immediate enquiry

attributes.action: Ban the use of wild animals in circuses in the U.K.
attributes.background:
In 2012 the Government made a commitment to ban the use of wild animals in travelling circuses before the end of 2015, it is now 2017 and there is still no ban.
With 94.5% of the public wanting to see this practice relegated to the history books, is it not time the U.K. followed suit?
attributes.additional_details:
Reasons why a ban is needed :
Wild animals do not jump through rings of fire, balance on balls or stand on their front legs voluntarily.
Circuses travel nearly all year round so the complex needs of wild animals can never be adequately met. 
Many undercover investigations have revealed evidence of circuses mistreating their animals.

attributes.action: People with permanent disabilities can apply for disability benefits immediately
attributes.background: Disabled benefits like PIP (formerly DLA), the Personal Independence Payment, make people wait 3 months before they can apply. Many other forms of help such as blue badges also require PIP as a form of proof of disability. Disabilities such as the loss of a limb should be allowed PIP immediately.
attributes.additional_details:
About PIP
https://www.gov.uk/pip/eligibility

attributes.action: Create a benefit for bereaved parents.
attributes.background: Currently in the U.K. there is a pension and a one off payment of £2000 of your partner dies. Well what if your child dies? Benefits for bereaved parents would give them time to grieve after loss.
attributes.additional_details:
Parents should not be struggling to make ends meet and worrying about how to pay the mortgage after the death of a child. 
They should be given a minimum of 6 months paid leave if their child dies, to come to terms with their loss. This would create a better working environment in the long run and better mental health for the parent/s affected. Also aftercare counselling should be provided for them to aid them in their wellbeing.

attributes.action: Prevent councils from moving homeless people into other areas without permission
attributes.background:
Private companies are buying up housing stock, evicting the tenants, then offering the properties to the local council as temporary accommodation for the homeless.

If the council says "no," the firm offers the properties to another local authority to move their homeless people into.
attributes.additional_details:
In Peterborough, a private firm evicted tenants and their families from 74 homes on a single estate then offered the properties to Peterborough City Council as temporary accommodation.

The firm told the council that if it did not take up the properties, they would be used by a London borough for its homeless people.

This practice is going on around the country and is causing misery for many people. 

See:

http://tinyurl.com/zf9atnv

http://tinyurl.com/zsyc6x6

http://tinyurl.com/hro3dqp

attributes.action: Amend the recall of parliament act 2015 to allow the electorate to dismiss MPs
attributes.background:
Amend the recall of parliament act 2015 to allow for fresh elections when 40% of the last turnout at a constituency election signs a petition calling for that.

The British public demand the means to remove our MPs if they are not acting in the interest of the British people
attributes.additional_details:
For far too long, prospective members of parliament and political parties of all denominations, have lied to the British public in order to get elected. 

The only way to ensure that those elected to office, keep their word once chosen to speak for the people, is to give the public the right to sack their MPs or government in much the same way that you would sack a negligent or under performing employee.

Many MP's are openly disregarding the will of the people and should therefore be removed.

attributes.action: More real term funding for schools, based on a per pupil funding formula
attributes.background: The government is imposing real term funding cuts on schools by freezing per-pupil funding while inflation and cost of employer pension and national insurance contributions increase. This affects all schools and academies alike. Without further funding schools will lose £3bn in real terms by 2020.
attributes.additional_details:
Wirral UNISON and other school unions do not want children in this country to miss out on a decent education, supplied by dedicated teachers and support staff with sufficient resources.
Average primary school cut is £87,000 or £339 per pupil.
Average secondary cut is £405,000 or £477 per pupil.
Visit http://www.schoolcuts.org.uk/#/ for more information.
Early indications had shown Wirral losing £10,759,698, figures now show this to be £15,696,153. 
That is 421 teachers or 872 support staff !

attributes.action: Make Security Industry Authority reform systems, processes and payment schemes
attributes.background: The SIA was designed to improve security standards across the UK and enforce the PSI act, however many people in the industry are unhappy with the pricing structure and lack of support given by the SIA. A review of the ACS pricing is required to make it affordable to small businesses
attributes.additional_details:
The ACS is overpriced for many smaller companies and is a requirement of tenders, therefore the scheme is damaging small businesses.

The SIA advised thousands of companies to proceed with ISO 9001 or ACS in preparation for business licence - these clients were misinformed and want a review of how this happened.

More support and training needed, not fines. People feel they are just interested in money

Internal computer system isn't fit for purpose 

Phone lines to be brought online for public

attributes.action: The housing crisis is creating homelessness; we need lower rents and more houses
attributes.background: We want the Government to build more houses because the more houses there are, the cheaper they will be. The Government should introduce a new rent cap so that people can afford a house to live in. It's not a laughing matter and the Government cannot let this carry on because it is destroying lives!
attributes.additional_details:
We are class 5 and we are proud to present  Saint Mary's Catholic Primary School's petition. Homelessness is not a problem; it is a crisis. This needs to be addressed immediately.

So we do hope that this turns into reality because homelessness is no joke. How would you feel if you were homeless? Who would you turn to in your hour of need? Why is the Government not taking responsibility for this disturbing crisis? 

Sign this petition today or it could be you living on the streets tomorrow.

attributes.action: I want to see a mandatory Driving ban for using a mobile device when driving.
attributes.background: People are being killed on the roads in the UK due to irresponsible motorists using mobile devices whilst driving. The law should be changed to ensure that any motorist using a mobile device whilst driving should receive an automatic driving disqualification of 6 months for a first time offence.
attributes.additional_details: A driver who recently killed three children and a woman whilst he was distracted whilst using his mobile device received a ten year custodial sentence. He had previously been warned about using a mobile device whilst driving by his employers yet he still continued to flout the law.

attributes.action: Stop Winchburgh village being used as a flight path for Edinburgh airport
attributes.background: Edinburgh Airport is proposing changes to their current flight paths.  They issued a consultation last year which did not include Winchburgh, therefore discouraging residents from responding. The new proposed flight paths now include Winchburgh meaning residents have been mislead.
attributes.additional_details: In the Phase 2 material, it is stated that flight paths have been devised based on feedback from Phase 1 consultation.  Proposed preferred flight paths C5 and D0 would fly directly over an area the consultation stated would be unaffected.  They are therefore unviable according to the rules governing changes to existing flight paths. One of the airport’s key criterion is noise impact on fewest people below 7000ft.  Population data from 2001 was used, showing 2k residents when it's closer to 10k.

attributes.action: Give an extra £350M each week to the NHS on the same day as serving Article 50.
attributes.background: This was a significant promise made during the referendum, and should be delivered.

attributes.action: Make sharing content of disabled children with the intent to humiliate illegal.
attributes.background: The number of hate crime incidences against disabled people are increasing. This is fuelled by sharing disparaging social media content. Disabled children often don't have a voice to defend themselves so should have special protection against behaviour which feeds dangerous negative attitudes.

attributes.action: Make stillbirth training mandatory for student midwifes before work placements
attributes.background: Many midwifes end up going out onto placement in hospitals without any experience or knowledge in how to deal with the emotional effects of stillbirth on parents. By making stillbirth training mandatory it will improve services provided to the parents they are dealing with in maternity wards.

attributes.action: maternity to be paid for at least 1 year on a % of 85-95
attributes.background: If a minimum sallary is £1200 a month it is impossible to survive with £500 a month in maternity period. The private rent is so expensive not to mention utilities and food, the maternity should be paid for 1 year like other countries and with a % of 85-95 of the sallary.

attributes.action: DWP and its contractors to have mandatory training in understanding Autism.
attributes.background: Since the Conservative Govt have been in power and the treasury have stated that major changes will happen for AUSTERITY. Myself and many families looking after Autistic children/adults have been made to feel that AUTISM is not a disability. Many families are struggling with the loss of benefits.
attributes.additional_details: As a mother of 2 Autistic children I have joined many groups online.  Reading stories of family's being told they can no longer have benefits with a diagnosis of Autism. We need change to make DWP and its contractors aware that Autism is a lifelong, developmental disability that affects how a person communicates with and relates to other people, and how they experience the world around them, Without these benefits they cannot have carers or support please STOP AUSTERITY WITH AUTISM

attributes.action: Give grieving parents of a stillborn baby a birth certificate
attributes.background:
We lost our gorgeous son Bobby at 41 weeks. We never expected to be told there was no heartbeat.
He was perfect in every way yet we left the hospital a day later with a box and a death certifate. No birth certificate just a death certificate. As if our little boy was never here...
attributes.additional_details:
Looseing a child at any age is heartbreaking. You never get over the pain of leaving your child behind. It's not natural to any parent to part with them.
To go in to labour anxious and excited to meet ur tiny baby, to then have to leave the hospital empty handed. 
Your then told you don't get a birth certificate. Your baby isn't registered a child. 
All babies, no matter how long they have been here for, deserve to be recognised as a person. 
It's time this became the norm! 
Help all us grieving parents out there to make a simple change that would make the world of difference to a horrendous situation.

attributes.action: Reinstate Legal Aid for family law matters.
attributes.background: Many parents are struggling to arrange contact with their children following separation, and do not have the funds to employ legal representation. Dealing with the separation is hard enough, without trying to cope with the administrative side of things as well.

attributes.action: Any future referendum vote on Scottish Independence must be given to all the UK.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom is exactly that..United.  As part of a legal union Scotland should NOT be able to decide alone on independence as the consequences will affect ALL of the UK economically and politically.

attributes.action: Scrap plans for HS2 and invest the money in our Armed Forces and NHS.
attributes.background: A country the size of Britain does not need this type of rail service. People on the average wage won't be able afford to use this just rich business people. This money spent on our NHS & Armed Forces would enable us to rebuild them to there former glorys!

attributes.action: Music venues, small business exemption from business rate increase set for April
attributes.background: Commercial property in the Uk will have its business rates revalued to mirror property value in the area. Indepedent business, music venues, theatres will close. Theresa May stand by your words "I want to build an economy that works for all, that means working with and listening to smaller firms.”

attributes.action: Condemn Trump's Muslim travel ban & accept those affected by it in the UK.
attributes.background: We ask the Prime Minister to condemn President Trump's orders banning citizens of Iraq, Iran, Syria, Yemen, Libya, Sudan and Somalia from entering the USA and preventing Muslim refugees from travelling to the USA. We also ask that the UK accepts all those turned away by the USA during this crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
On Holocaust Memorial Day of all days, Donald Trump signed Executive Orders that amount to a de facto ban on Muslims and refugees entering the United States. On the same day, the UK Prime Minister met with him and proclaimed the strength of the friendship between our nations. Friends don't let friends enforce a bigoted, ineffective, paranoid and religiously-motivated border policy. 

The UK should model good humanitarian behaviour and accept all of those turned away by the US during this crisis.

attributes.action: Reduce Overseas Aid from 0.7% GDP to 0.35% to fund Social Care in the UK
attributes.background: Social Care in the UK is hugely underfunded. Meanwhile our Overseas Aid budget of 0.7% of GDP (@£12bn) is among the most generous in the world. Reduce the target to 0.35%, which is more in line with Germany 0.4%, Canada 0.3% and USA 0.2%, and release the estimated £6bn to fund Social Care in the UK.

attributes.action: Ensure all apprentices are paid the National Minimum Wage for their age.
attributes.background: The current rate is £3.40 per hour as of October 2016, (rising to £3.50 as of April 2017)  for apprentices aged 16 to 18 and those aged 19 or over who are in their first year. All other apprentices are entitled to the National Minimum Wage for their age)
attributes.additional_details:
Apprentices who earn just £3.40 an hour are struggling to make ends meet.  This wage is not financially viable.  In addition, an apprentice can spend a high proportion of their wage travelling to work.  
Apprentices should be paid National Minimum Wage from the start. 
Apprenticeships can be an important way for young people to get into employment and earn while they learn. But young workers should not be used as cheap labour.  All young people deserve to be paid a decent minimum wage.

attributes.action: Review and revoke private prison contracts and return to the public sector.
attributes.background: The government sold the contract for running some of our jails to private companies. These are now dangerous and staff are in fear every day of their working lives. PRISONS SHOULD NOT BE FOR PROFIT.

attributes.action: Waive bridge tolls for motorists in Warrington, Chester and Cheshire West.
attributes.background: Motorists will have to pay to cross the new Mersey Gateway Bridge and existing silver Jublee bridge – despite some being promised tolls would be scrapped to save them £1,080 a year. Sign to show your support for scrapping these charges.

attributes.action: Hold a public vote on the options for the future UK/EU (and global) trade model
attributes.background: In June the UK electorate voted to leave the EU by a narrow majority. It has since become clear that there was no clear plan defined and little information given about the options. A public decision can only be valid if a clear intent of the direction the government wishes to take us is proposed.
attributes.additional_details:
The outcome of the advisory referendum on 23rd June means that the government must now propose defined exit plans for terms of leaving the EU.

However, leaving the EU is too momentous a decision to proceed without a clear understanding of the proposed model.

We call for a public vote to be held before Article 50 is invoked, on the options for the future UK/EU (and global) trade model with impartial assessments of the consequences of each option, including the option of staying in the EU.

attributes.action: Require all Chancellors of the Exchequer to publish their annual tax returns.
attributes.background: The Chancellor of the Exchequer is the government’s chief financial minister and as such is responsible for raising revenue through taxation. As a sign of openness, and accountability to the tax payer, the current and future Chancellors must publicly prove the integrity of their own tax affairs.
attributes.additional_details:
There have been a number of high profile examples of companies, and celebrities, that have managed to pay very little tax despite having incomes that few of us could realistically hope to achieve. Even though this is currently legal, the last Prime Minister described this as "morally wrong". 

It should be the case that anyone holding the position of Chancellor of the Exchequer publicly shows that they possess high moral standards when it comes to their own tax affairs. 

Thank you.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for councils to warn of lethal risks of food recycling bins.
attributes.background: Toxic mould from recycling caddies can be fatal to people & pets including cats & dogs due to risks of Mycotoxicosis.2 dogs recently, nearly died due to this,1 is still fighting for its life.Councils are currently failing to warn of potential lethal risks.We ask you ensure they do as a duty of care.
attributes.additional_details:
Below is the council concerned's link that doesn't appear to warn of lethal mould risks:http://www.dacorum.gov.uk/home/environment-street-care/recycling-refuse-waste/household-waste-recycling/food-waste-caddies 

See The Wheelhouse Veterinary Centre (1 of 3 vets treating the dogs) post about it:

https://www.facebook.com/TheWheelhouseVets/posts/1422334514507038 

800+ comments,1000+ reactions,7000+ shares in < 3 days  evidences owner trauma, public shock, lack of risk awareness & costs of £10K

attributes.action: Put climate change at the top of the agenda in discussions with President Trump.
attributes.background: At this crucial time of establishing relationships with the new President, it should be made clear that climate change is the most pressing concern we currently have.

attributes.action: Include same sex relationships as grounds for divorce under adultery
attributes.background: It seems absurd that a same sex couple can get married but if one of them should stray with a same sex person outside of the marriage adultery cannot be cited as grounds for divorce.
attributes.additional_details:
The same can be said for a traditional marriage where either partner has a relationship outside with a person the same sex as themselves, this isn't recognised as adultery.

This law should be overhauled to state that having sexual relations outside of marriage with any person is adultery.

attributes.action: Make animal farming and production processes part of the national curriculum.
attributes.background: Our food and what we consume is a fundamental part of our lives as human beings. But many people are unaware of the reality of the production processes used within the meat, dairy, and egg industries.
attributes.additional_details: Explicit education, including actual filmed footage of these processes should be placed within the national curriculum as a compulsory subject within secondary education in the UK. This would help people, and especially future generations, to make more informed choices about what they wish to consume and fund through their spending on food and related products.

attributes.action: Condemn US travel ban, ensure no UK complicity in its enforcement.
attributes.background: The government should affirm that the travel ban is discriminatory,  contrary to international law and abhorrent, and consider steps to ensure that UK airports, airlines in UK airports or headquartered there and employees of the UK Government are not complicit in the travel ban.
attributes.additional_details: This petition follows the Prime Minister's inadequate response to the travel ban imposed by the United States Government on the nationals of seven Muslim-majority countries and suspension of refugee admissions  (in the Executive Order “Protecting the Nation from Terrorist Entry into the United States by Foreign Nationals” of 27 January 2017).

attributes.action: Grant Award winning Palestinian peace activist Iyad Burnat a UK visa!
attributes.background: Iyad Burnat is an award winning peace activist. He has,since 2005, led weekly non-violent protests in his village of Bil'in against the Israeli West Bank barrier. His work as a peace activist has allowed him to travel in the US & Europe & we demand that the UK government grant him a visa.

attributes.action: Ensure that the triple lock on the Basic State Pension is retained
attributes.background:
The government is considering ending this
The triple lock is a guarantee to increase the state pension every year by the higher of inflation, average earnings or a minimum of 2.5%.
This is essential to ensure the poorest of retired people can manage in winter

attributes.action: Public enquiry over the last decade regarding social service/cafcass failings
attributes.background:
The failings of both social services/cafcass
And reluctance to follow up on detrimental information their reluctance to participate this alienated parents and their dismissal of information
attributes.additional_details: Information can be supplied by various groups

attributes.action: Protect Local Authority centrally held funding for Early Years Intervention
attributes.background:
Government changes to Early Years centrally held funding are threatening the existence of the outstanding Pen Green Centre, a pioneer in early years integration. 
NCC funds the majority of the centre's work via the centrally held fund and changes will inadvertently see a savage reduction in budget.
attributes.additional_details:
We know DfE did not intend to threaten the country’s largest and most innovative nursery school.
Whilst we support the principle of funds being redirected to the front line we urgently request the government ring-fence funds for Pen Green and other integrated nursery schools before February 2017. 

Furthermore we urge the government to enact a caveat to the future funding arrangements whereby integrated nursery schools are protected financially to continue their outstanding work from hereon in.

attributes.action: Military personnel to have military hearing before they proceed to civil courts.
attributes.background: In the past any suggestion of wrong doing by military personnel was investigated by the military - if any was discovered and thought to be serious enough it was passed to the civil courts to deal with.

attributes.action: Ban the use of inhumane rodent glue traps in the UK
attributes.background:
Rodent glue traps are mats covered in a very sticky adhesive from which it's victims cannot escape. It can take hours, even days from being caught to being killed, in which time they will usually die from exhaustion in the attempt to escape.
Let's get these disgusting things banned. Thank you.
attributes.additional_details: Ireland and New Zealand have banned glue traps and many major stores around the world have stopped selling them.

attributes.action: Increase penalties against fly tippers and fund additional enforcement capacity
attributes.background: Fly tipping blights communities and offenders rarely convicted. To consider, a)increase fixed penalties to £1,000 with £50,000 fines &12-month prison for serious offenders; b)recover all clear up costs; c) confiscate offenders’ vehicles and remove driving licence; d)provide funding to key agencies
attributes.additional_details: Fly tipping is a growing problem that blights communities across the country, costing around £100m a year to clean up and increasingly the focus of organised criminal gangs. Enforcement and effective penalties are key to tackling this nationwide problem and needs to be much tougher. There also needs to be multi-agency national strategy in place and that bodies such as the Police, Local Authorities and Environment Agency are given sufficient resources to tackle the problem effectively.

attributes.action: Legalise the sale & use of cannabis for people over the age of 25
attributes.background: The only reason it's illegal in the UK is because the government says it's bad for your health. They don't seem to mind that drinking & smoking is bad for your health & can actually kill you, unlike cannabis. There is no reason why the government should intervene if over-25's choose to use cannabis.
attributes.additional_details: Studies have shown that continuous recreational use of cannabis coincides with a slight gradual lack of IQ development but only up to the age of 25. Clinical scientific research has also shown conclusively that cannabis has a wide range of health benefits including the ability of the THC molecule to kill some cancers while leaving normal healthy cells unharmed. Criminalising the cure for cancer amounts to genocide. Experienced users know how to use it safely. The government should just back off.

attributes.action: Demand routine testing for dangerous and fatal infections during pregnancy
attributes.background: In 2014, I was pregnant with my daughter. I visited my doctor complaining of abdominal pain and was not testing for anything. A few weeks later I was rushed to hospital in preterm labour, and my baby was delivered at 20 weeks. She survived only 2 hours. I had chorioamnionitis that went untreated.
attributes.additional_details:
•25% of preterm labours are due to emergency events, including undiagnosed infections
•These infections can be detected with examinations, urine cultures, vaginal/rectal swabs and blood tests 
•If left undetected can cause inflammation of the fetal membranes/amniotic sac, leading a medical emergency named chorioamnionitis 
•Can trigger preterm contractions, premature rupture of membranes, placental abruption and imminent delivery 
•Delivery prior to 24 weeks is fatal, and otherwise dangerous

attributes.action: UK GOVERNMENT TO ACTIVELY PURSUE URGENT PEACE NEGOTIATIONS IN SYRIA
attributes.background: How long will this unrelentless suffering, mass destruction  and massacre of innocent lives continue to be silenced, ignored and accepted by the international community ?
attributes.additional_details:
After six years the Syrian civil war is increasing with rage  with no end in sight. 
Since the  war began, as many as 386,000 people have been killed, including nearly 14,000 children.  The war has become more deadly since foreign powers have joined the conflict.  The only way to end this catastrophe is for the world to stand together and remove Assad and his regime. 

Eastern Aleppo has become the key strategic battleground and an epitome of this brutal, barbaric and morally shameless and tragic war in Syria.  It has been besieged, bombed, starved and strangled as part of the Assad’s regime ‘Starve or Kneel’ strategy. 

Let's show the innocent children of Syria and its people that their lives do matter, that we do care and the world has not forgotten!

attributes.action: Prevent Ministers and MP's to talk until debate runs out of time.
attributes.background: The Government to impose a time restriction on Ministers and MP's to talk in Private Members Bills debates in line with the time given to debate. The current system gives members the opportunity to talk until time runs out, shelving the debate. This is not democratic and discredits the system.
attributes.additional_details: The current system allows for Ministers and Members of Parliament to be able to talk out Private Members Bills when they know they are running out of time. Placing time restrictions on Members of Parliament and Ministers in attendance of the debate in relation to the time that can be given to a debate (minimum or maximum) to stop shelving Bills. Bills should be voted on in Parliament whether they progress to the next stage or refused without a third option, to talk out a debate.
